unnormalised: ## My Relationship With Music Streaming: It's Complicated (Like a Karan Johar Movie)
normalised: ## My Relationship With Music Streaming: It's Complicated (Like a Karan Johar Movie)

unnormalised: Okay, let's be real. My relationship with music streaming apps is as complicated as Rahul and Anjali's love triangle in *Kuch Kuch Hota Hai*. One minute I’m serenading my auto-rickshaw driver with a classic Kishore Kumar hit I discovered on Spotify’s “Retro Rewind” playlist, the next I’m rage-deleting the app because it keeps suggesting Honey Singh after I explicitly said “NO, MUSIC IS MY SANSKAR!”
normalised: Okay, let's be real. My relationship with music streaming apps is as complicated as Rahul and Anjali's love triangle in *Kuch Kuch Hota Hai*. One minute I’m serenading my auto-rickshaw driver with a classic Kishore Kumar hit I discovered on Spotify’s “Retro Rewind” playlist, the next I’m rage-deleting the app because it keeps suggesting Honey Singh after I explicitly said “NO, MUSIC IS MY SANSKAR!”

unnormalised: It all started innocently enough. My cousin, Priya from IIT Delhi (smart girl, always ahead of the curve), told me to ditch my dusty old cassettes and "join the 21st century, you auntie!". Reluctantly, I downloaded *that* app. You know, the one with the green logo. I won’t name names; I don’t want them sending me personalized ads for *even more* Honey Singh.
normalised: It all started innocently enough. My cousin, Priya from I I T Delhi (smart girl, always ahead of the curve), told me to ditch my dusty old cassettes and "join the twenty first century, you auntie!". Reluctantly, I downloaded *that* app. You know, the one with the green logo. I won’t name names; I don’t want them sending me personalized ads for *even more* Honey Singh.

unnormalised: The initial novelty was exhilarating. Suddenly, I had access to *everything*. Ghazals I hadn’t heard since my Dadi sang them at weddings, obscure remixes of Bollywood classics, even that one embarrassing boy band I was obsessed with in Class 8. (Don’t judge, *everybody* loved Aasma).
normalised: The initial novelty was exhilarating. Suddenly, I had access to *everything*. Ghazals I hadn’t heard since my Dadi sang them at weddings, obscure remixes of Bollywood classics, even that one embarrassing boy band I was obsessed with in Class eight. (Don’t judge, *everybody* loved Aasma).

unnormalised: But then the dark side crept in. The autoplay algorithm. Oh, the *horror*. I’m listening to a soulful rendition of a Meera bhajan and then BAM! Some auto-tuned Punjabi rap song about…well, let’s just say things Dadi wouldn't approve of.
normalised: But then the dark side crept in. The autoplay algorithm. Oh, the *horror*. I’m listening to a soulful rendition of a Meera bhajan and then BAM! Some auto-tuned Punjabi rap song about…well, let’s just say things Dadi wouldn't approve of.

unnormalised: And the data usage! Lord Krishna, the data usage. Jio is my savior, but even they can't keep up with my insatiable thirst for 90s Bollywood bangers. Last month, I accidentally used 15 GB streaming “Chaiyya Chaiyya” on repeat while stuck in Bangalore traffic (the usual, right?).
normalised: And the data usage! Lord Krishna, the data usage. Jio is my savior, but even they can't keep up with my insatiable thirst for nineties Bollywood bangers. Last month, I accidentally used fifteen G B streaming “Chaiyya Chaiyya” on repeat while stuck in Bangalore traffic (the usual, right?).

unnormalised: So, yes, my relationship with music streaming is a rollercoaster. One minute I’m blissfully transported back to my childhood, the next I’m desperately trying to figure out how to block all traces of Badshah from my recommended playlist. But hey, at least I can finally ditch those cassettes. Priya would be proud. Maybe. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to go delete another Honey Singh recommendation. Shanti, shanti, shanti.
normalised: So, yes, my relationship with music streaming is a rollercoaster. One minute I’m blissfully transported back to my childhood, the next I’m desperately trying to figure out how to block all traces of Badshah from my recommended playlist. But hey, at least I can finally ditch those cassettes. Priya would be proud. Maybe. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to go delete another Honey Singh recommendation. Shanti, shanti, shanti.
